content.question:
<math alttext="B a with a positive 2 charge aqueous ion reacts with S O 4 with a negative 2 charge aqueous ion to produce B a S O 4 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ba</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>BaSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
A student obtains a <math alttext="10.0 gram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of a white powder labeled as <math alttext="B a C l 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>BaCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>. After completely dissolving the powder in <math alttext="50.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of distilled water, the student adds excess <math alttext="N a 2 S O 4 solid" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, which causes a precipitate of <math alttext="B a S O 4 solid" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>BaSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> to form, as represented by the equation above. The student filters the <math alttext="B a S O 4 solid" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>BaSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, rinses it, and dries it until its mass is constant. Which of the following scientific questions could best be answered based on the results of the experiment?

choices.label: Is the <math alttext="N a 2 S O 4 solid" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> used in the experiment pure?

Is the <math alttext="B a C l 2 solid" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>BaCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> used in the experiment pure?
What is the molar solubility of <math alttext="B a C l 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>BaCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> in water?
What is the molar solubility of <math alttext="B a S O 4" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>BaSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> in water?

content.answer: Is the <math alttext="B a C l 2 solid" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>BaCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> used in the experiment pure?

skill.text: 2.A: Identify a testable scientific question based on an observation, data, or a model.
